page.title: 01TRANSPORT IN DACRE.
page.content: The main route through its area is the A66 dual carriage way linking the west Cumbrian coast with the M6 motorway. It is a busy road with industrial and service transport and tourist cars and caravans especially in Summer. It provides a speedy line between Dacre and Penrith for village residents and farmers in the Dacre vally. A survey of traffic taken over 1 hour from 11.45am on July 2nd 1985 showed over 300 vehicles using end carriage way, making a total of 638 vehicles per hour passing through the area. The majority were cars and lorries - the latter carrying a range of goods, frozen food, glass, chemicals, animal foods, furniture and fuel. The village of Dacre is served by a rural bus every Tuesday and mini bus for school children daily.
